intro: Rhynchosia harae subsp. ovalifoliolata, commonly known as the oval-leaved rhynchosia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive oval-shaped leaflets and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
